name: DeployGreenProduction
description: Deploys a new Green to the specified Production with CloudShell Colony
author: Quali

inputs.name: colonyEndpoint
inputs.label: Service Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: This is the name of the connection that you entered when you created the "CloudShell Colony service connection" during the plugin configuration.

inputs.name: timeout
inputs.label: Timeout
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set the timeout for this step (in minutes), if your new Green will not be ready when the timeout is reached, CloudShell Colony will abort the deployment.

inputs.name: space
inputs.label: Space name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter a name for your CloudShell Colony space.

inputs.name: productionId
inputs.label: production Id
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the Id of the production's Green you want started.

inputs.name: artifacts
inputs.label: Artifacts
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this blueprint has artifacts, you may specify them in a comma/semi-comma/newline separated list of artifact names and their values. e.g., artifact1 name=value1, artifact2 name=value2

inputs.name: Inputs
inputs.label: Inputs
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this blueprint has inputs, you may specify them in a comma/semi-comma/newline separated list of input names and their values. e.g., input1 name=value1, input2 name=value2

outputVariables.name: Production_Green_Details
outputVariables.description: All the Production's Green details including instances' IP addresses, ports and other infrastructure details required to properly run your tests. You may query this parameter to get the required information.

outputVariables.name: productionId
outputVariables.description: The identifier of the production environment. You will use this identifier to end your sandbox when needed.
